extracted-table.table-caption: Neuropsychological testing results from the 10 cases presented.
extracted-table.table-wrap-foot: All tests scores are corrected referring to respective Italian normative data (see methods).*: These are raw scores, as it was not possible to correct scores for Years of Education and Age.**: These scores refer to a modified version of the PPT.§: This patient underwent similar naming and comprehension tests from a different battery (BADA); see text for details.°: Numeric scores were not available.Bold scores are pathological.

caption.title: Neuropsychological testing results from the 10 cases presented.

fn.p: All tests scores are corrected referring to respective Italian normative data (see methods).
*: These are raw scores, as it was not possible to correct scores for Years of Education and Age.
**: These scores refer to a modified version of the PPT.
§: This patient underwent similar naming and comprehension tests from a different battery (BADA); see text for details.

extracted-table.table-caption: Table showing ROIs significantly correlated to Confrontation Naming Test percentages scores.
extracted-table.table-wrap-foot: Significance was set at P uncorrected <0.05. Structural Regions of Interest were extracted by normalized and published ATLAS (see text for details). P-values and coordinates are relative to the activation peaks of each ROI (see also Fig. 1C).

caption.title: Table showing ROIs significantly correlated to Confrontation Naming Test percentages scores.

td.bold: Negative correlation between Hypometabolism and Confrontation Naming Tests

fn.p: Significance was set at P uncorrected <0.05. Structural Regions of Interest were extracted by normalized and published ATLAS (see text for details). P-values and coordinates are relative to the activation peaks of each ROI (see also Fig. 1C).

extracted-table.table-wrap-foot: A) mean FA values and B) mean MD values extracted from the bilateral uncinate fasciculus and the bilateral inferior longitudinal fasciculus. From left to right, columns indicate mean values in control group, standard deviation in control group, 5th percentile (FA: lower FA, lower white-matter integrity) or 95th percentile (MD values: higher the MD index, greater the microstructural degeneration) of the distribution of microstructural indices in healthy controls, values of case 1, values of case 3, values of case 10. Patients’ values being lower than the 5th percentile (FA) or higher the 95th percentile (MD) of the distribution healthy controls’ values are marked in red.* marks significant values.

fn.p: A) mean FA values and B) mean MD values extracted from the bilateral uncinate fasciculus and the bilateral inferior longitudinal fasciculus. From left to right, columns indicate mean values in control group, standard deviation in control group, 5th percentile (FA: lower FA, lower white-matter integrity) or 95th percentile (MD values: higher the MD index, greater the microstructural degeneration) of the distribution of microstructural indices in healthy controls, values of case 1, values of case 3, values of case 10. Patients’ values being lower than the 5th percentile (FA) or higher the 95th percentile (MD) of the distribution healthy controls’ values are marked in red.
